findings.name: Missing Content-Security-Policy
findings.description: The application is missing the Content-Security-Policy header. XSS mitigation
findings.remediation: Implement strict input validation and follow the principle of least privilege.

findings.name: A03: SSTI (Verified)
findings.description: Server-Side Template Injection confirmed in parameter 'utm_medium'.
findings.remediation: Ensure user input is not passed directly to template engine evaluation functions.

findings.description: The application is missing the X-Content-Type-Options header. MIME sniffing protection
findings.remediation: Implement strict input validation and follow the principle of least privilege.

findings.name: A03: SQL Injection (Verified)
findings.description: SQL error triggered in parameter 'cid'
findings.evidence: Response contains error signature: syntax error
findings.remediation: Use parameterized queries (Prepared Statements) for all database access.

attack_path.narrative: The presence of SQL Injection allows an attacker to bypass authentication and directly exfiltrate the database. Combined with discovered endpoints, this could lead to full administrative takeover.
steps: 1. Bypass authentication using identified SQLi vector.
2. Dump 'users' table to obtain administrative credentials.
3. Log in as administrator and achieve RCE via file upload/template editing.
